title: Spending and Revenue
description: The San Francisco Controller's Office maintains a database of spending and revenue data sourced from it's citywide financial system. This data is presented on the Spending and Revenue report hosted at http://openbook.sfgov.org, and is also available in this dataset in CSV format. New data is added on a weekly basis, and is available from fiscal year 2000 forward.

columns.name: Fiscal Year
columns.description: An accounting period of 12 months. The City and County of San Francisco operates on a fiscal year that begins on July 1 and ends on June 30 the following year. The Fiscal Year ending June 30, 2012 is represented as FY2011-2012.

columns.name: Organization Group Code
columns.description: Org Group is a group of Departments. For example, the Public Protection Org Group includes departments such as the Police, Fire, Adult Probation, District Attorney, and Sheriff.

columns.name: Organization Group
columns.description: Org Group is a group of Departments. For example, the Public Protection Org Group includes departments such as the Police, Fire, Adult Probation, District Attorney, and Sheriff.

columns.name: Department Code
columns.description: Departments are the primary organizational unit used by the City and County of San Francisco. Examples include Recreation and Parks, Public Works, and the Police Department.

columns.name: Department
columns.description: Departments are the primary organizational unit used by the City and County of San Francisco. Examples include Recreation and Parks, Public Works, and the Police Department.

columns.name: Program Code
columns.description: A program identifies the services a department provides. For example, the Police Department has programs for Patrol, Investigations, and Administration.

columns.name: Program
columns.description: A program identifies the services a department provides. For example, the Police Department has programs for Patrol, Investigations, and Administration.

columns.name: Character Code
columns.description: In the type hierarchy, Character is the highest level. For example, salaries, benefits, contractual services, and materials & supplies are recorded as different Characters.

columns.name: Character
columns.description: In the type hierarchy, Character is the highest level. For example, salaries, benefits, contractual services, and materials & supplies are recorded as different Characters.

columns.name: Object Code
columns.description: In the type hierarchy, Object is the middle level. For example, within the Salaries Character, Objects differentiate between Permanent Salaries, Temporary Salaries, and Overtime pay.

columns.name: Object
columns.description: In the type hierarchy, Object is the middle level. For example, within the Salaries Character, Objects differentiate between Permanent Salaries, Temporary Salaries, and Overtime pay.

columns.name: Sub-object Code
columns.description: In the type hierarchy, Sub-object is the lowest level of detail. For instance, within the Overtime Object, Sub-object segregates overtime for nurses from overtime for police officers and fire fighters (known as uniformed staff).

columns.name: Sub-object
columns.description: In the type hierarchy, Sub-object is the lowest level of detail. For instance, within the Overtime Object, Sub-object segregates overtime for nurses from overtime for police officers and fire fighters (known as uniformed staff).

columns.name: Fund Type Code
columns.description: In the Fund hierarchy, Fund Type is the highest level, and is used to group Funds according to governmental accounting standards.

columns.name: Fund Type
columns.description: In the Fund hierarchy, Fund Type is the highest level, and is used to group Funds according to governmental accounting standards.

columns.name: Fund Code
columns.description: In the Fund hierarchy, Fund is the middle level. For example, within the Special Revenue Fund Type, you can find the Children’s Fund and the Open Space & Park Fund.

columns.name: Fund
columns.description: In the Fund hierarchy, Fund is the middle level. For example, within the Special Revenue Fund Type, you can find the Children’s Fund and the Open Space & Park Fund.

columns.name: Fund Category Code
columns.description: In the Fund hierarchy, Fund Category is the lowest level. Within Fund, Fund Categories group activity by their characteristics: Operating, Annual Projects, Continuing Projects, Grants, Interdepartmental/Work Order.

columns.name: Fund Category
columns.description: In the Fund hierarchy, Fund Category is the lowest level. Within Fund, Fund Categories group activity by their characteristics: Operating, Annual Projects, Continuing Projects, Grants, Interdepartmental/Work Order.

columns.name: Revenue or Spending
columns.description: Revenue or Spending

columns.name: Amount
columns.description: The amount earned (Revenue) or spent (Spending) by the City and County of San Francisco.

columns.name: data_as_of
columns.description: Timestamp the data was updated in the source system.

columns.name: data_loaded_at
columns.description: Timestamp the data was loaded to the open data portal.
